intro: Delphinium cappadocicum, commonly known as the Cappadocia larkspur, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Turkey. It features tall, slender stems that can grow up to 1.5 meters in height, adorned with striking blue to purple flowers. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are deeply lobed, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and alpine settings. Its botanical characteristics make it a notable species within the Delphinium genus.
